translated: The phrase when night had fallen means that it was evening.üîΩThe phrase the twenty high peaks of the mountain of false views concerning identity means that the mountain of false views concerning identity is the object of the five perpetuating aggregates. The phrase the twenty high peaks means that the mountain of false views concerning identity is like a mountain because it is difficult to climb.üîΩThe phrase the twenty high peaks means that the mountain of false views concerning identity is like a mountain because it is difficult to climb. The twenty high peaks are as follows: The self is form, like a lord; the self possesses form, like an ornament; form belongs to the self, like a servant; the self resides in form, like a vessel; the self is in form, like a container; the self is supported by form, like a wall; the self is not supported by form, like space; the self is the enjoyer, like a king; the self is the experiencer, like a musician; the self is the agent, like a potter.

analyzed: nyi shu zhes bya ba ni bdag gzugs yin te bdag po dang 'dra ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan te rgyan dang 'dra ba dang / gzugs bdag gi yin te bran dang 'dra ba dang / gzugs la bdag gnas te snod dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: The phrase the twenty high peaks means that the mountain of false views concerning identity is like a mountain because it is difficult to climb. The twenty high peaks are as follows: The self is form, like a lord; the self possesses form, like an ornament; form belongs to the self, like a servant; the self resides in form, like a vessel; the self is in form, like a container; the self is supported by form, like a wall; the self is not supported by form, like space; the self is the enjoyer, like a king; the self is the experiencer, like a musician; the self is the agent, like a potter.

translated: The twenty aspects of the view of self are: the self possesses consciousness, like an ornament; consciousness belongs to the self, like a servant; the self possesses form, like a fool possesses a stick; the self is based on form, like a person on the ground; the self is based on feeling, like a person on a seat; the self is based on perception, like a person on a bed; the self is based on volitional factors, like a person on a throne; the self is based on consciousness, like a person in a house; the self is the same as form, like a person is the same as a house; the self is other than form, like a person is other than a house; the self is the same as feeling, like a person is the same as a house; the self is other than feeling, like a person is other than a house; the self is the same as perception, like a person is the same as a house; the self is other than perception, like a person is other than a house; the self is the same as volitional factors, like a person is the same as a house; the self is other than volitional factors, like a person is other than a house; the self is the same as consciousness, like a person is the same as a house; the self is other than consciousness, like a person is other than a house.

analyzed: g-yas phyogs nas bskor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means having circumambulated to the right.

original: mkha' la song zhes bya ba ni bar snang la song zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mkha' la song zhes bya ba ni bar snang la song zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having gone into the sky means having gone into the intermediate space.

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa ste sngon bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi slob ma dge slong du gyur pa'i tshe ming mi mjed kyi bdag po zhes bya bar gyur pa'i ming de nyid ding song yang ming du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag po zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa ste sngon bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi slob ma dge slong du gyur pa'i tshe ming mi mjed kyi bdag po zhes bya bar gyur pa'i ming de nyid ding song yang ming du brjod pa'o //
translated: The Lord of the SahƒÅ world is BrahmƒÅ, who was formerly a monk disciple of the Blessed Light Keeper, and at that time was named the Lord of the SahƒÅ world. That very name is used even now.

original: gzhung kha cig las tshogs kyi bdag po zhes kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las tshogs kyi bdag po zhes kyang 'byung ste /
translated: In some texts, it appears as the Lord of the Assembly.

original: bdud kyi 'khor la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ming de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ming de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called the Lord of the retinue of demons, etc.

original: 'byor pa che ba zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gis so //
analyzed: 'byor pa che ba zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gis so //
translated: He is called ‚Äúvery wealthy‚Äù because of his sovereignty.

original: mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni nus pas so //
analyzed: mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni nus pas so //
translated: He is called ‚Äúvery powerful‚Äù because of his ability.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rab 'thab bral lam yongs su dga' ldan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rab 'thab bral lam yongs su dga' ldan la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù are the gods of YƒÅma, Tu·π£ita, etc.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i mjug thogs su tshe gnyis pa la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i mjug thogs su tshe gnyis pa la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced after rebirth is that which is to be experienced in the second lifetime after rebirth.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba'i tshe rabs gsum la sogs pa'i tshe rabs gzhan gyi rigs kyis myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zhes bya ba'i tshe rabs gsum la sogs pa'i tshe rabs gzhan gyi rigs kyis myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced in another lifetime is that which is to be experienced in a third lifetime, etc.

original: lung phog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bdag la lung phog pa dang bdag gis gzhan la lung phog pa'o //
analyzed: lung phog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bdag la lung phog pa dang bdag gis gzhan la lung phog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPrediction‚Äù is the prediction of oneself by another or the prediction of another by oneself.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa shes zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la thos pa dang bsams pa las byungüîΩba'i shes pa goms pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa shes zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa goms pa'o //
translated: Skill in dependent origination is the repeated practice of the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection with regard to the nature of cause and effect, as it is stated: Conditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions; conditioned by the karmic predispositions, there is consciousness, and so on.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi srid pa dang mi @76b srid pa dag la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi srid pa dang mi @76b srid pa dag la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Skill in what is possible and impossible is the discernment, by means of the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection, of what is possible and impossible for things.

original: tshogs kyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshogs kyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: The aggregate of causes is the cause itself.

original: lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de zhes bya ba ni mkhur tshos bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de zhes bya ba ni mkhur tshos bzhag ste'o //
translated: Placing one's cheek in one's hand means placing one's cheek in one's palm.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of fetters:

original: 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang ; ma rig pa'i sbyor ba dag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang ; ma rig pa'i sbyor ba dag go //
translated: the fetters of desire, existence, views, and ignorance.

original: yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: That which is to be transcended is that which is to be abandoned.

original: thub pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Lord of Sages is the Tathagata.

original: rigs gces pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rigs gtso bo ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rigs gces pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rigs gtso bo ma yin pa ste /
translated: Not of a good family means not of the foremost family.

original: bram ze'am rgyal rigs ni rnam par dag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bram ze'am rgyal rigs ni rnam par dag par 'gyur la /
translated: The Brahmin and Kshatriya families are pure,

original: gzhan ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: but not the others.

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni phyug po dang / dbul po dang / 'bring gi khyim mo //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni phyug po dang / dbul po dang / 'bring gi khyim mo //
translated: House means the houses of the rich, the poor, and the middle class.

original: rus zhes bya ba ni koondi n+ya'i rus dang / ba sis tha'i rus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rus zhes bya ba ni koondi n+ya'i rus dang / ba sis tha'i rus la sogs pa'o //
translated: Lineage means the lineages of Kaundinya, Vasistha, and so on.

original: khyim ni nye du'i tshogs so //
analyzed: khyim ni nye du'i tshogs so //
translated: House is the group of relatives.

original: rus ni rgyud brgyad pa la sogs pa dang nye du ma yin pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: rus ni rgyud brgyad pa la sogs pa dang nye du ma yin pa'i tshogs te /
translated: Lineage is the group of non-relatives, such as those of the eighth generation and so on.

original: khyim dang rigs kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: khyim dang rigs kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: This is the distinction between house and lineage.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: Practice means accomplishing the path of seeing and so on.

original: thugs brtse ba'i slad ces bya ba ni thugs rje la brten nas so //
analyzed: thugs brtse ba'i slad ces bya ba ni thugs rje la brten nas so //
translated: Out of compassion means based on compassion.

original: dge slong tshur shog bya bas zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba yod pa de ni dge slong tshur shog pa'o//
analyzed: dge slong tshur shog bya bas zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba yod pa de ni dge slong tshur shog pa'o//
translated: The phrase come, monk! refers to the rite in which the words come, monk! are uttered.

original: gang la khas blang bar bya ba dang / byed du 'jug pa tsam kho nas rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba ste /üîΩsmon lam btab pa'i phyir slob dpon la sogs pa la mi ltos pas de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang la khas blang bar bya ba dang / byed du 'jug pa tsam kho nas rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba ste / smon lam btab pa'i phyir slob dpon la sogs pa la mi ltos pas de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The rite is completed merely by the acceptance and the mere act of ordination.

original: bka'i mjug kho nar zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ma thag kho nar ro //üîΩsnam sbyar gyon pa'i lus ldan zhang //üîΩzhes bya ba la snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam bur dras shing sbyar ba'i chos gos te /
analyzed: bka'i mjug kho nar zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ma thag kho nar ro // snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus ldan zhang // zhes bya ba la snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam bur dras shing sbyar ba'i chos gos te /
translated: The phrase at that very moment means that the rite is completed at the very moment the words are uttered.üîΩThe phrase his body clothed in the outer robe means that the body is clothed in the outer robe.

original: gang gi lus la de gyon pa de ni snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus dang ldan pa'o //üîΩmod la dbang po rab zhir gnas gyur te //
analyzed: gang gi lus la de gyon pa de ni snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus dang ldan pa'o //üîΩmod la dbang po rab zhir gnas gyur te //
translated: The outer robe is a monastic robe that is cut and sewn from separate pieces of cloth.üîΩThe phrase his faculties become tranquil means that his faculties become tranquil at that very moment.

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i mod la dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bar gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i mod la dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bar gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: As soon as he went forth, his faculties became very calm.

original: dgongs pas zhes bya ba ni thugs la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas zhes bya ba ni thugs la dgongs pa'o //
translated: By his intention means by his thought.

original: de dag gis ci zhig dgongs par gyur ce na /
analyzed: de dag gis ci zhig dgongs par gyur ce na /
translated: What did he intend?

original: de'i lus gzugs bkab par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i lus gzugs bkab par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: His body will be covered with a robe.üîΩHis body will be covered means that his body will be covered with a robe.

original: lus gzugs zhes bya ba rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: lus gzugs zhes bya ba rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: The body is the natural state of the body.

original: @77a * // de bkab pa ni 'gebs shing g-yogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: @77a * // de bkab pa ni 'gebs shing g-yogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Covered means covered and concealed.

original: cha lugs so //
analyzed: cha lugs so //
translated: It is the appearance.

original: cha lugs de dang ldan par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cha lugs de dang ldan par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that he will have that appearance.

original: grong gi byang phyogs zhes bya ba ni grong nas ha cang mi ring ba'i byang phyogs logs kyi ngos na'o //
analyzed: grong gi byang phyogs zhes bya ba ni grong nas ha cang mi ring ba'i byang phyogs logs kyi ngos na'o //
translated: To the north of the village means on the northern side, not too far from the village.

original: nyon mongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phongs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phongs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He will be afflicted means he will be in distress.

original: thos pa nyung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos nyung du thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa nyung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos nyung du thos pa'o //
translated: He will have little learning means he will have little learning of the treatises.

original: thos pa nyung du dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos ji ltar thos pa bzhin ma bsams pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa nyung du dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos ji ltar thos pa bzhin ma bsams pa ste /
translated: One who is endowed with little learning is one who has not reflected on the treatises as he has heard them.

original: mngon par brtson par ma byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par brtson par ma byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is one who has not made effort, that is, he has not made effort to reflect on the treatises.

original: grong tshigs zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyogs so //üîΩmi rtag pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya bar zhugs pa bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: grong tshigs zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyogs so // mi rtag pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya bar zhugs pa bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: A village is a part of a town.üîΩThe notion of impermanence is the notion of the basic meditative absorption level that engages the thought all compositional factors are impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The notion of suffering in relation to the impermanent is the notion of the basic meditative absorption level that engages the thought whatever is impermanent and possesses defilements is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa sdug bsngal gang yin pa de la rang dbang med do zhes bya bar 'du shes pa bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa sdug bsngal gang yin pa de la rang dbang med do zhes bya bar 'du shes pa bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of selflessness in regard to suffering is the idea that whatever is contaminated suffering is powerless.

original: zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni zas la mi phyogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni zas la mi phyogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of disgust in regard to food is the idea of aversion to food.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum po dag la mi phyogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum po dag la mi phyogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of non-delight in regard to the whole world is the idea of aversion to the three worlds.

original: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The idea of danger is the idea of the danger of change.

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: Abandonment is the cessation of the defilements and secondary defilements such as passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags 'gog pa'o //
translated: Freedom from passion is the cessation of passion.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa spong ba'o //
translated: Cessation is the abandonment of form, etc.

original: shi ba zhes bya ba ni tshe'i 'du byed 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: shi ba zhes bya ba ni tshe'i 'du byed 'gag pa'o //
translated: Death is the cessation of the life faculty.

original: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni rus pa'i keng rus la dmigs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni rus pa'i keng rus la dmigs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of the ugly is the perception of a skeleton.

original: rnam par bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni lus rul zhing sngon por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni lus rul zhing sngon por gyur pa'o //
translated: The perception of the livid is the perception of a corpse that is swollen and discolored.üîΩThe perception of the festering is the perception of a corpse that is oozing pus.

original: rnam par rnags pa zhes bya ba ni rnag 'dzag pa'o //üîΩrnam par bam pa zhes bya ba ni skrangs shing bsngos pa'o //üîΩrnam par 'bus gzhigs pa zhes bya ba ni srin bus gzhigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rnags pa zhes bya ba ni rnag 'dzag pa'o // rnam par bam pa zhes bya ba ni skrangs shing bsngos pa'o // rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa zhes bya ba ni srin bus gzhigs pa'o //
translated: The perception of the cut up is the perception of a corpse that is sliced up.üîΩThe perception of the gnawed is the perception of a corpse that is being eaten.üîΩThe perception of the scattered is the perception of a corpse that is scattered in pieces.

original: rnam par zos pa zhes bya ba ni sha bar @77b bar du zos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par zos pa zhes bya ba ni sha bar @77b bar du zos pa'o //
translated: The perception of the hacked and scattered is the perception of a corpse that is cut up and scattered in pieces.

original: rnam par dmar ba zhes bya ba ni dmar ba'i rnam pa'o //üîΩrnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnam par 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dmar ba zhes bya ba ni dmar ba'i rnam pa'o // rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnam par 'thor ba'o //
translated: The perception of the bleeding is the perception of a corpse that is oozing blood.üîΩThe perception of the festering and bleeding is the perception of a corpse that is oozing pus and blood.

original: rus gong gi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni thod pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rus gong gi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni thod pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of a skeleton is the perception of a skull and so on.

original: stong pa nyid du so sor rtog pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la rtog pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid dang gang zag gi bdag nyid kyis stong bar sems par bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du so sor rtog pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la rtog pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid dang gang zag gi bdag nyid kyis stong bar sems par bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception called ‚Äúdiscernment of emptiness‚Äù is the perception of the stage of the actual meditative concentration, which is the discernment of the emptiness of the self of the person and the self of the phenomena of the world.

original: bsam gtan dang po zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The first meditative concentration is that which is accompanied by investigation and sustained thought.

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'o //
translated: The second is that which is free of investigation but accompanied by sustained thought.

original: gsum pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med cing bde ba'o //üîΩbzhi pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang med cing /
analyzed: gsum pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med cing bde ba'o // bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang med cing /
translated: The third is that which is free of both investigation and sustained thought but is accompanied by joy and pleasure.

original: bde ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang med pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is free of both investigation and sustained thought, and also free of joy and pleasure.

original: byams pa zhes bya ba ni kye ma sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig ces mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa'i zhe sdang med pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa zhes bya ba ni kye ma sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig ces mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa'i zhe sdang med pa ste /
translated: Loving kindness is the absence of hatred on the stage of the actual meditative concentration, which arises from the aspiration, ‚ÄúOh, may sentient beings be happy!‚Äù

original: mdza' bshes dag las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdza' bshes dag las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from friends.

original: snying rje zhes bya ba ni kye ma sems can rnams ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i zhe sdang med pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje zhes bya ba ni kye ma sems can rnams ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i zhe sdang med pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the absence of hatred on the level of the absorptions, arising from the aspiration, ‚ÄúAlas, sentient beings are suffering.‚Äù

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni kye ma sems can rnams dga' bar gyur cig ces mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyis pa'i yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni kye ma sems can rnams dga' bar gyur cig ces mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyis pa'i yid bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction on the level of the absorptions, arising from the aspiration, ‚ÄúAlas, sentient beings should be joyful.‚Äù

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes bya bar mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyis pa'i 'dod pa med pa'o //üîΩnam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas so //üîΩrnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes bya bar mos pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyis pa'i 'dod pa med pa'o // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas so // rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //

original: slob ma la gdams pa zhes bya ba ni lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma la gdams pa zhes bya ba ni lam bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase instruction to disciples means teaching the path.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i zhes bya ba ni dka' thub kyi'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i zhes bya ba ni dka' thub kyi'o //
translated: The phrase the practice of pure conduct means asceticism.

original: 'bras bu ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi 'bras bu las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi 'bras bu las bsams pa'o //
translated: What is the result?üîΩThis is from the point of view of the direct result.üîΩWhat is the benefit?

original: phan ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni zhar las byung ba'i 'bras bu las bsams so //
analyzed: phan ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni zhar las byung ba'i 'bras bu las bsams so //
translated: This is from the point of view of the indirect result.

original: 'di ltar lta zhing zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lta zhing zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
translated: Seeing in this way is by means of knowledge.

original: 'di skad smras te zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'di skad smras te zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: Speaking in this way is by means of words.

original: byin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
analyzed: byin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
translated: Giving is giving for the sake of benefiting others.

original: mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
translated: Sacrifice is giving for the sake of worship.

original: sbyin sreg ces bya ba ni mer blugs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ces bya ba ni mer blugs pa'o //
translated: Homa is pouring into fire.

original: legs par spyad pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong ba'o //üîΩnyes par spyad pa @94a * //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong ba'o // nyes par spyad pa @94a * //
translated: Good conduct is the avoidance of killing and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bad conduct is killing and so on.

original: de dag la skur pa 'debs pa ni rgyu'i dngos po 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la skur pa 'debs pa ni rgyu'i dngos po 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Denial of these is the denial of their causal nature.

original: las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'gog par byed do //
translated: The statement there is no result of actions, no ripening of actions is a denial of the result.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do 'jig rten pha rol med do //üîΩma med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do 'jig rten pha rol med do // ma med do //
translated: The statement there is no this world, no other world is a denial of the cause and result of actions.

original: pha med do //
analyzed: pha med do //
translated: The statement there is no mother, no father is a denial of the cause and result of actions.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig lngas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gnyis 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig lngas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gnyis 'gog par byed do //
translated: The statement there are no beings who are reborn spontaneously is a denial of the two things, cause and result.

original: rdzus te skye ba zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa'o //
translated: The term reborn spontaneously refers to intermediate existence.

original: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thar pa'i lam 'gog par byed pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thar pa'i lam 'gog par byed pa'o /
translated: The statement there is no world and so on is a denial of the path to liberation.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa ste de'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par rtogs pa yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa ste de'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par rtogs pa yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The term worthy of offerings refers to the arhat. In order to teach his particular qualities, the text says he has perfect knowledge and perfect practice.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The term perfect knowledge refers to the possession of right knowledge.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCorrect practice‚Äù means practice that is not erroneous.

original: de dag gi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir gang dag tshe 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir gang dag tshe 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to teach their distinctions, he says, ‚ÄúThose who, in this very life‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rang gi mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyi shes pas so //
analyzed: rang gi mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyi shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy their own superknowledge‚Äù means by their own knowledge.

original: mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas nas zhes bya ba ni shes par byas nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving actualized‚Äù means having known.

original: bsgrub ste zhes bya ba ni shes pa de thos nas te /
analyzed: bsgrub ste zhes bya ba ni shes pa de thos nas te /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving accomplished‚Äù means having heard that knowledge.

original: 'thob pa mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'thob pa mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúhaving actualized the attainment.‚Äù

original: go bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mthong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: go bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mthong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving caused to understand‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving caused to see.‚Äù

original: de dag med pa 'di la rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag med pa 'di la rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for their non-existence?

original: de'i phyir srog 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIn this very life‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir srog bdag ni cho 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing srog de phyis mjug tu shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis chad cing zad par 'gyur la gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis zhig cing chud za bar 'gyur te shi ba'i 'og tu shes pa'i bdag nyid dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog bdag ni cho 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing srog de phyis mjug tu shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis chad cing zad par 'gyur la gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis zhig cing chud za bar 'gyur te shi ba'i 'og tu shes pa'i bdag nyid dang /
translated: Because the self that is the life force exists in this life, and that life force is severed and exhausted by the self of the consciousness that exists later in the end. It is destroyed and wasted by the self of the form aggregate.üîΩ

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid gnyi gas chad par 'gyur zhing mi 'byung ba de'i phyir byin pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid gnyi gas chad par 'gyur zhing mi 'byung ba de'i phyir byin pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the self that is the life force is annihilated and exhausted by the nature of consciousness, and it is destroyed and wasted away by the nature of form, and after death it is annihilated by both the nature of consciousness and the nature of form, and it does not arise. Therefore, giving and so on do not exist.

original: 'o na gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, where does it go?

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe body of a person,‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig bdag ni chad par 'gyur na skyes bu lus 'di gar 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig bdag ni chad par 'gyur na skyes bu lus 'di gar 'gro zhe na /
translated: If the self is annihilated, where does this body of a person go?

original: skyes bu'i lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi las 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni 'chi ba'i dus ni 'byung ba chen po @94b bzhi pa dag gi bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi las 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni 'chi ba'i dus ni 'byung ba chen po @94b bzhi pa dag gi bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of a person, which is a product of the four great elements, at the time of death dissolves into the four great elements.

original: mi la sogs pa dbang po rnams ni nam mkha'i bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa dbang po rnams ni nam mkha'i bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The faculties of humans and so on dissolve into space.

original: ro ni ro gzhag pa'i khri dang de 'degs pa'i mi bzhi'i khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis dur khrod du mer bsregs te /
analyzed: ro ni ro gzhag pa'i khri dang de 'degs pa'i mi bzhi'i khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis dur khrod du mer bsregs te /
translated: The corpse is placed on a bier, and five men carry it to the charnel ground.üîΩThe corpse is burned in a fire, and the bones remain the color of doves.

original: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsregs pa la sogs pa'i rus pa dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas te skyes bu'i 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsregs pa la sogs pa'i rus pa dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas te skyes bu'i 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the way of humans.

original: 'o na sbyin pa dang len pa dag su sa bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na sbyin pa dang len pa dag su sa bstan ce na /
translated: But who are the givers and receivers of generosity?

original: de'i phyir rmongs pa nye bar bstan pa ni sbyin pa la mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni len to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rmongs pa nye bar bstan pa ni sbyin pa la mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni len to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThe teaching of delusion is the giver, and the teaching of skill in generosity is the receiver.‚Äù

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa'o //
translated: Delusion is stupidity.

original: nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang po bstan pa ste de ni rmongs pa yin pas dang po 'ga' zhig gis nye bar bstan pa'i dring 'jog cing mi phan bzhin du sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dang po bstan pa ste de ni rmongs pa yin pas dang po 'ga' zhig gis nye bar bstan pa'i dring 'jog cing mi phan bzhin du sbyin par byed de /
translated: Teaching is the initial instruction. Since that is delusion, some people at the beginning rely on the teaching of others and give without benefit.

original: mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni 'phral gyi thob rgyal gyis zug zug tu len par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni 'phral gyi thob rgyal gyis zug zug tu len par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The wise are taught that they should bear the pain of the present by means of the king of medicines.

original: 'o na yod par smra ba dag gis 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ma bstan tam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yod par smra ba dag gis 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ma bstan tam zhe na /
translated: But, it may be asked, haven't the realists taught about the existence of other worlds and so on?

original: de'i phyir de la gang dag yod par smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gang dag yod par smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Those who say that it exists... and so on.

original: 'o na da ltar mdzangs ngan la sogs pa med dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na da ltar mdzangs ngan la sogs pa med dam zhe na /
translated: But, it may be asked, aren't there now the wise and the foolish?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar byis pa dang mkhas pa de gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar byis pa dang mkhas pa de gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, In this way, those two, the foolish and the wise... and so on.

original: lam gol bar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i shes pa spangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol bar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i shes pa spangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Engaging in a wrong path means having abandoned right knowledge.

original: lam ngan pa legs par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni lam log pa lus dang ngag gnyis kyi rjes su sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam ngan pa legs par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni lam log pa lus dang ngag gnyis kyi rjes su sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Correctly practicing a bad path means practicing in accordance with the wrong path of body and speech. This is what it means.

original: lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni der song na 'jigs pa dang phrad par 'gyur bas lam de snga nas spang bar bya dgos bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni der song na 'jigs pa dang phrad par 'gyur bas lam de snga nas spang bar bya dgos bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as a fearful road is to be avoided, so too is a teacher who is like a fearful road.

original: blo ngan ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: blo ngan ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: A bad mind is one that is internally oriented.

original: log par ston byed pa zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: log par ston byed pa zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: One who teaches wrongly is one who teaches incorrectly.

original: dman pas zhes bya ba ni byis pas so //üîΩston par grags pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa ma yin pa ston par grags pa'o //
analyzed: dman pas zhes bya ba ni byis pas so // ston par grags pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa ma yin pa ston par grags pa'o //
translated: An inferior person is a foolish person.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni ston pa de'i'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni ston pa de'i'o //
translated: One who is known as a teacher is one who is not a teacher but is known as a teacher.üîΩHis is the Dharma that is like that.

original: chos 'di de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid dang chad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid dang chad par lta ba'o //
translated: The Dharma is like that in that it is nihilistic and it teaches a view of annihilation.

original: de'i chos min ci zhig 'dra zhes bya ba ni chos de pas ches dman pa'i chos ma yin pa med pa'i phyir de'i chos ma yin pa gzhan mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha @95a * //
analyzed: de'i chos min ci zhig 'dra zhes bya ba ni chos de pas ches dman pa'i chos ma yin pa med pa'i phyir de'i chos ma yin pa gzhan mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha @95a * //
translated: What is not his Dharma? There is nothing that is not his Dharma, because there is no Dharma that is worse than that. Therefore, there is nothing else that is not his Dharma.

original: tshig go // zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni de skad smras nas so //
analyzed: tshig go // zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni de skad smras nas so //
translated: The words having said this means having spoken in this way.üîΩHaving struck the palm of his hand with his palm, as if empty, the Teacher said: The palm of my hand is empty of a second palm of my hand, and yet it is not empty of the palm of my hand. Likewise, the world is empty of a soul, and yet it is not empty of the five appropriative aggregates.üîΩJust as when one strikes an empty vessel, such as a pot, with a stick, and one knows that there is no substance inside, in the same way, the Teacher struck with the words of a counter-argument, and made known that there is no substance of his own doctrine inside the mind of the opponent.

original: sod stong pa bzhin du brdabs te zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyis stong pa'i snod song mo la sogs par brdabs te sgra phyung na nang na rdzas med par shes pa bzhin du ston pa de yang brgal zhing brtag pa'i tshig gis brdabs te rang gi gzhung lugs
analyzed: sod stong pa bzhin du brdabs te zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyis stong pa'i snod song mo la sogs par brdabs te sgra phyung na nang na rdzas med par shes pa bzhin du ston pa de yang brgal zhing brtag pa'i tshig gis brdabs te rang gi gzhung lugs
translated: The words having struck the palm of his hand with his palm, as if empty mean having made a sound with the words of his own doctrine, as if striking an empty vessel, such as a pot, with a stick.üîΩThe words the palm of my hand is empty of a second palm of my hand mean that the palm of the hand is empty of a second palm of the hand.üîΩThe words and yet it is not empty of the palm of my hand mean that it is not empty of the palm of my hand itself.üîΩLikewise, the world is empty of a soul means that the world is empty of a permanent, unitary, and independent soul.

original: smras pa'i sgra phyung na blo'i nang na ngon gyi rdzas med par shes par bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa'i sgra phyung na blo'i nang na ngon gyi rdzas med par shes par bya ba'i tha tshig go // kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The words and yet it is not empty of the five appropriative aggregates mean that it is not empty of the five appropriative aggregates, which are the basis of the designation of a soul.

original: rgyu med ces bya ba ni nang gi goms pa la sogs pa'i rgyu med pa'o //üîΩrkyen med ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa'i byed rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med ces bya ba ni nang gi goms pa la sogs pa'i rgyu med pa'o //üîΩrkyen med ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa'i byed rgyu med pa'o //
translated: The words the world is empty of a soul mean that the world is empty of a soul that is different from the aggregates.

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn terms of purification‚Äù means in terms of liberation from cyclic existence.

original: de dag gis ni 'jug pa'i rgyu dang ldog pa'i rgyu 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'jug pa'i rgyu dang ldog pa'i rgyu 'gog par byed do //
translated: They refute the cause of engagement and the cause of disengagement.

original: shes pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo mi rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-cognition‚Äù means non-apprehension of an entity.

original: mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag mi rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-seeing‚Äù means non-apprehension of a specific attribute.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCognition‚Äù and ‚Äúseeing‚Äù are the opposite of those.

original: 'dis ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa shes pa dang mi shes pa gnyis rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa shes pa dang mi shes pa gnyis rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gog par byed do //
translated: This refutes the assertion that cognition and non-cognition are the cause of engagement and disengagement, respectively.

original: stobs zhes bya ba ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: stobs zhes bya ba ni nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPower‚Äù means ability.

original: brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni spro ba'o//
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni spro ba'o//
translated: ‚ÄúExertion‚Äù means enthusiasm.

original: de gnyis ka bsdus pa ni stobs dang brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de gnyis ka bsdus pa ni stobs dang brtson 'grus so //
translated: The combination of those two is ‚Äúpower and exertion.‚Äù

original: skyes bu'i rtsal zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i zho sha ste rang gi nus pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i zho sha ste rang gi nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHuman effort‚Äù is the strength of a person, one‚Äôs own ability.

original: pha rol gnon pa zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis nus pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis nus pa'o //
translated: The term subduing others refers to the power of skillful means.

original: de gnyis bsdus pa ni skyes pa'i rtsal dang pha rol gnon pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis bsdus pa ni skyes pa'i rtsal dang pha rol gnon pa'o //
translated: The term power of self and others is a combination of the two.

original: bdag gi rtsal zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi nus pa'o//
analyzed: bdag gi rtsal zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi nus pa'o//
translated: The term power of self refers to one's own power.

original: gzhan gyi rtsal zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtsal zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi nus pa'o //
translated: The term power of others refers to the power of others.

original: de gnyis bsdus pa ni bdag gi rtsal dang gzhan gyi rtsal lo //
analyzed: de gnyis bsdus pa ni bdag gi rtsal dang gzhan gyi rtsal lo //
translated: The term power of self and others is a combination of the two.

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: The term sentient beings refers to gods and humans.

original: srog chags zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags so //
analyzed: srog chags zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags so //
translated: The term living beings refers to those born in the animal realm.

original: 'byung po zhes bya ba ni yi dags la sogs pa mi snang ba'i srog chags so //
analyzed: 'byung po zhes bya ba ni yi dags la sogs pa mi snang ba'i srog chags so //
translated: The term beings refers to hungry ghosts and other invisible creatures.

original: mthu med ces bya ba ni yid kyi stobs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mthu med ces bya ba ni yid kyi stobs dang bral ba'o //
translated: The term powerless refers to those lacking mental strength.

original: stobs med ces bya ba ni lus kyi stobs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: stobs med ces bya ba ni lus kyi stobs dang bral ba'o //
translated: The term weak refers to those lacking physical strength.

original: dbang med ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i stobs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dbang med ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i stobs dang bral ba'o //

original: gnas mal gyi mthun par 'bogs par byed ces bya ba ni mthun par mi brdeg par ro //
analyzed: gnas mal gyi mthun par 'bogs par byed ces bya ba ni mthun par mi brdeg par ro //
translated: The phrase you are assigned to a bed means that you are assigned to a bed that is suitable for you.

original: dper na chu med pa las autpa la bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu med pa las autpa la bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba bzhin no //
translated: The phrase just as a lotus is not born from dry land means that it is not born in a place that is devoid of water.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes yang dag pas shes pa'i yul ma lus par rdzogs par thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes yang dag pas shes pa'i yul ma lus par rdzogs par thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: The phrase a perfect buddha means that one who has realized the perfect knowledge of all objects of knowledge without error is a buddha.

original: bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar spro bar byas nas gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis so //
analyzed: bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar spro bar byas nas gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúHe should be appointed‚Äù means that after previously encouraging him, he should be appointed by means of a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

original: dbyung bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni las de las so //
analyzed: dbyung bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni las de las so //
translated: ‚ÄúHe should be dismissed‚Äù means that he should be dismissed from that legal procedure.

original: gnas mal phog pa dang ma phog pa mi shes zhes bya ba ni brjed nges pa'o //
analyzed: gnas mal phog pa dang ma phog pa mi shes zhes bya ba ni brjed nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not know whether or not the beds and seats have been assigned‚Äù means that he is forgetful.

original: gnas mal 'bogs pa zhes bya ba ni stobs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas mal 'bogs pa zhes bya ba ni stobs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe assigns the beds and seats‚Äù means that he distributes them.

original: gsol ba byas te las bya ba ni gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las so //
analyzed: gsol ba byas te las bya ba ni gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las so //
translated: ‚ÄúHe should be appointed by means of a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements‚Äù means that he should be appointed by means of a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

original: gtam dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par gtan la 'bebs pas zhes bya ba'i gtam zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: gtam dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par gtan la 'bebs pas zhes bya ba'i gtam zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe resolves disputes by means of a discussion that is connected with a discussion‚Äù means that a discussion is a teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'brel pa'i gtam zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'brel zhing phan tshun chos spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i gtam zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'brel zhing phan tshun chos spyod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA discussion that is connected with a discussion‚Äù means that it is a discussion that is connected with and mutually engaged in Dharma practice.

original: gtam dang 'brel pa'i gtam de gnyis kyis chos rnam par 'byed pa ni gtam dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: gtam dang 'brel pa'i gtam de gnyis kyis chos rnam par 'byed pa ni gtam dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: ‚ÄúHe resolves disputes by means of a discussion that is connected with a discussion‚Äù means that he resolves disputes by means of those two discussions.

original: @100b rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mtshan nyid rmad du byung ba'o //
analyzed: @100b rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mtshan nyid rmad du byung ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúmiracle‚Äù is the marvelous characteristic of the miracle.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi khyad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi khyad par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDwelling‚Äù is the knowledge of the particular dwelling.

original: gnyug mar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nges par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nges par gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding‚Äù is the fixed dwelling.

original: gsol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be asked‚Äù is to perform the act of asking, the act of asking twice, and the act of asking three times.

original: gtams pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gtams pa srung ba'o //
analyzed: gtams pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gtams pa srung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be remembered‚Äù is to protect what is remembered by another.

original: lugs ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas zas bsod pa dang / 'bring dang / ngan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lugs ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas zas bsod pa dang / 'bring dang / ngan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccording to the rule‚Äù is to follow the established rule, and to follow the good, middling, and bad food.

original: rgan rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: rgan rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAccording to seniority‚Äù is to follow the elders.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rim bzhin du bar mi 'dor bar ro //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rim bzhin du bar mi 'dor bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAccording to the order‚Äù is to follow the order without omission.

original: thod rgal med par zhes bya ba ni bkol bar mi 'os pa bkol bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: thod rgal med par zhes bya ba ni bkol bar mi 'os pa bkol bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout skipping‚Äù means not using what is not fit to be used.

original: mtha'i gtsug lag ces bya ba ni mjug na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: mtha'i gtsug lag ces bya ba ni mjug na 'dug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFinal training‚Äù means that which is at the end.

original: gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyams can te thams cad du smod par kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyams can te thams cad du smod par kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúConduct of corruption‚Äù means being self-destructive, which is to say, conduct that is universally despised.

original: mi bzod ces bya ba ni rtag tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bzod ces bya ba ni rtag tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIntolerable‚Äù means that it occurs constantly.

original: mi mdzes shing zhes bya ba ni ma legs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mdzes shing zhes bya ba ni ma legs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnseemly‚Äù means not good.

original: ltung ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma byung ba la'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma byung ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a downfall‚Äù means without a downfall having occurred.

original: gzhi ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa'i gzhi gsum med par ro //
analyzed: gzhi ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa'i gzhi gsum med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a basis‚Äù means without the three bases of seeing, hearing, or suspecting.

original: de la mthong ba ni bdag nyid kyi mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la mthong ba ni bdag nyid kyi mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù means seeing with one‚Äôs own eyes.

original: thos pa ni gzhan las gtam thos pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thos pa ni gzhan las gtam thos pa ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúHearing‚Äù means not hearing a report from another person.

original: yol ba la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i phag na mi tshangs par spyad pa la sogs pa byed pa'i sgra bdag nyid kyi rna bas thos pa'o //
analyzed: yol ba la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i phag na mi tshangs par spyad pa la sogs pa byed pa'i sgra bdag nyid kyi rna bas thos pa'o //
translated: The sound of someone engaging in sexual misconduct behind a curtain, etc. is heard with one's own ears.

original: dogs pa ni bar du tha gus drang ba la sogs pas brtag dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni bar du tha gus drang ba la sogs pas brtag dgos pa'o //
translated: Doubt is the need to investigate with a rope, etc.

original: dran pa dang ldan par zung shig ces bya ba ni de'i dran pa tshad mar gyur pa yin par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan par zung shig ces bya ba ni de'i dran pa tshad mar gyur pa yin par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Be mindful means make your memory reliable.

original: rang gis khas blangs pas bsnyil bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig gis ni phyi sar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gis khas blangs pas bsnyil bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig gis ni phyi sar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Expel by means of one's own admission means expel by one's own words.

original: gleng bar gyis shig ces bya ba ni dris shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gleng bar gyis shig ces bya ba ni dris shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Accuse means question.

original: brtag par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gtan la phob shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtag par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gtan la phob shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Investigate means determine.

original: 'dun pas smras zhes bya ba ni bdag la byams pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: 'dun pas smras zhes bya ba ni bdag la byams pa'i rgyus so //
translated: Out of affection for me, means out of love for me.

original: 'jigs pas smras zhes bya ba ni phyis gnod pa byed pas 'jigs @101a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pas smras zhes bya ba ni phyis gnod pa byed pas 'jigs @101a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Out of fear means out of fear of later harm.

original: lus can brdzun du smra ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can brdzun du smra ba'i chos gtso bo gcig las 'das par gyur cing 'jig rten pha rol dral cing smras pas byas pa ni tshe 'di nyid la sdig pa mi bya ba ci yang
analyzed: lus can brdzun du smra ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can brdzun du smra ba'i chos gtso bo gcig las 'das par gyur cing 'jig rten pha rol dral cing smras pas byas pa ni tshe 'di nyid la sdig pa mi bya ba ci yang
translated: Those who are liars, etc. are those who have transgressed the one principal quality of sentient beings who speak falsely, and those who have split the world in two by speaking falsely.

original: med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is nothing at all that is not sinful in this very life.

original: brdzun du smra ba sdig pa'i rgyu nyid dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba sdig pa'i rgyu nyid dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that lying is a cause of sin and a cause of suffering,üîΩhe says,

original: lcags gong me lce 'dra ba dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lcags gong me lce 'dra ba dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: burning iron balls, etc.

original: tshul 'chal ces bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chal ces bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: The term immoral means lying.

original: yang dag mi sdom pa zhes bya ba ni mi spong ba ste 'dis ni 'chal pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag mi sdom pa zhes bya ba ni mi spong ba ste 'dis ni 'chal pa bstan to //
translated: The term not restrained means not abandoning; this indicates immorality.

original: ngan to zhes bya ba ni smad pa'o //
analyzed: ngan to zhes bya ba ni smad pa'o //
translated: The term evil means blameworthy.

original: mi bzad do zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bzad do zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is intolerable because it harms oneself.

original: mchog tu mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is extremely intolerable because it harms others.

original: yang na 'jig rten 'di dang mi mthun pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol dang mi mthun pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten 'di dang mi mthun pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol dang mi mthun pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Or, it is intolerable because it is contrary to this world, and extremely intolerable because it is contrary to the next world, respectively.

original: de ma spangs na zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba nye bar spyod pa de ni mi spong zhing yang dang yang du byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ma spangs na zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba nye bar spyod pa de ni mi spong zhing yang dang yang du byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one does not abandon that, means if one does not abandon the enjoyment that will be described below, and if one repeatedly engages in it, that is the meaning of if one does not abandon that, and repeatedly engages in it.

original: bdag nyid tshul khrims 'chal cing zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //üîΩgzhan la tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: bdag nyid tshul khrims 'chal cing zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o // gzhan la tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Having become one who is immoral, means having become one who is not in meditative equipoise.

original: smra ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te gleng bar byed ces bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: smra ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te gleng bar byed ces bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: With regard to others, it is said, one who speaks about morality, which means one who discusses morality.

original: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po drung na gnas pa rgyas pa dang mdor bsdu ba la mos pa gnyi ga la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / phyir 'ongs pas sngar rgyas par bstan pas ma thob pa la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po drung na gnas pa rgyas pa dang mdor bsdu ba la mos pa gnyi ga la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / phyir 'ongs pas sngar rgyas par bstan pas ma thob pa la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The Teacher said further means that in order to benefit both those who are present and those who are absent, and in order to benefit those who were not present at the time of the extensive teaching, the Teacher said further.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba tshig bzlas pa la ltos pa dag yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba tshig bzlas pa la ltos pa dag yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in order to ripen the roots of virtue of those who depend on the repetition of the words, he said further.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the disadvantages of lying, he said:

original: tshig gis nyes smras rjod byed na //
analyzed: tshig gis nyes smras rjod byed na //
translated: If one speaks words that are false,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'thab krol zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'thab krol zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Disputes are the cause of harm.

original: rgyan pos 'thab krol du gyur pa yin na stod pa dang smod pa gnyis ji ltar 'thab krol yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyan pos 'thab krol du gyur pa yin na stod pa dang smod pa gnyis ji ltar 'thab krol yin zhe na /
translated: If disputes arise from gambling, how can praise and blame be disputes?üîΩTherefore, he said:

original: de'i phyir gang 'dir cho los zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'dir cho los zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here, disputes arise from gambling, from praise, and from blame.

original: cho lo zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: cho lo zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The game is the king's play.

original: rang nor pham byed pa zhes bya ba ni nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang nor pham byed pa zhes bya ba ni nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: The loss of one's own wealth is the loss of one's own wealth.

original: bstod pa dang smad pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin @101b gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la'o //
analyzed: bstod pa dang smad pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin @101b gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la'o //
translated: The praise and blame is of the Tathagata and the disciples of the Tathagata.

original: ji ltar na 'thab krol shin tu chen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thab krol shin tu chen po yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a very great quarrel?

original: de'i phyir 'phags pas smad pas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pas smad pas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, the noble ones despise him, etc.

original: 'phags pas smad pas zhes bya ba ni skye bo 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pas so //
analyzed: 'phags pas smad pas zhes bya ba ni skye bo 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pas so //
translated: The noble ones despise him is the slander of the noble ones by the people.

original: ngag yid sdig bsten na zhes bya ba ni ngag gis skur pa 'debs pa dang / yid kyis ngan sems bskyed na'o //
analyzed: ngag yid sdig bsten na zhes bya ba ni ngag gis skur pa 'debs pa dang / yid kyis ngan sems bskyed na'o //
translated: If he resorts to verbal and mental evil, he slanders with speech and generates evil thoughts with the mind.

original: bye ba brgya phrag stong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bye ba brgya phrag stong zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hundred times a hundred thousand is a hundred times a hundred thousand.

original: bye ba zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi gnas brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: bye ba zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi gnas brgyad pa ste /
translated: The hundred is the eighth place of the number.

original: brgya phrag stong ni bye ba phrag 'bum mo //
analyzed: brgya phrag stong ni bye ba phrag 'bum mo //
translated: A hundred thousand is a hundred times a hundred thousand.

original: dung phyur phrag sum cu drug dang ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dung phyur phrag sum cu drug dang ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be endowed with thirty-six hundred millions.

original: dung phyur zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi gnas dgu pa ste ;
analyzed: dung phyur zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi gnas dgu pa ste ;
translated: A hundred million is the ninth place in the enumeration of numbers.

original: de phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang lnga ni dung phyur phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: de phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang lnga ni dung phyur phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: Thirty six times that is 3,600,000,000,000.

original: skye bo 'phags pas smad pa gang dag ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas gzhan la skur pa 'debs shing smad pa dang / zhe sdang bskyed cing tshangs par spyod pa dang 'bral bar sems pa de dag ni lo grangs bye ba phrag 'bum dang / dung phyur phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ji snyed sems can dmyal ba rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gang dag bde bar gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: skye bo 'phags pas smad pa gang dag ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas gzhan la skur pa 'debs shing smad pa dang / zhe sdang bskyed cing tshangs par spyod pa dang 'bral bar sems pa de dag ni lo grangs bye ba phrag 'bum dang / dung phyur phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ji snyed sems can dmyal ba rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gang dag bde bar gshegs pa dang /
translated: Those who are despised by the noble ones, who slander and disparage others verbally and mentally, who give rise to hatred and think of separating them from pure conduct, will go to the hells for as many years as there are atoms in the earth, and for as many hundreds of thousands of eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras chos sgrog pa la sogs pa dag la ngag dang yid kyis 'thab krol byed pa de ni shin tu 'thab krol chen po yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras chos sgrog pa la sogs pa dag la ngag dang yid kyis 'thab krol byed pa de ni shin tu 'thab krol chen po yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, those who quarrel verbally and mentally with the Well-Gone Ones and their sons who proclaim the Dharma, that is a very great quarrel, this is the meaning.

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po las dbral lo snyam nas so //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po las dbral lo snyam nas so //
translated: Thinking, I will separate him from pure conduct, means thinking, I will separate him from the state of a monk.

original: dge slong dag pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: Monks means those without downfalls.

original: gzhi de'i ltung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gsum po gang gis skur pa de'i'o //
analyzed: gzhi de'i ltung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gsum po gang gis skur pa de'i'o //
translated: The absence of a downfall in that basis means the absence of a downfall in the three bases by which he is slandered.

original: brjod do cog ces bya ba ni rtsol ba tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod do cog ces bya ba ni rtsol ba tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Everything that is said means because of different efforts.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is seen and so forth.

original: brjed pa zhes bya ba ni mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: brjed pa zhes bya ba ni mi dran pa'o //

original: / gtang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan du bskur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: / gtang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan du bskur bar bya ba'o //

analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni bdag po gzhan nyid du rnam par bsam par bya ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa la sbyin par bya ba'o /

original: skya rengs shar nas zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i mgo rtsom pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na'o //
analyzed: skya rengs shar nas zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i mgo rtsom pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na'o //
translated: From sunrise means from the first appearance of dawn, the beginning of the day.

translated: If another arises means if the previous one has been abandoned, the subsequent one is abandoned by the previous one, even if less than ten days have passed.

original: gos gnyis zhes bya ba dang / gos mang po zhes bya ba'i tshar gnyis smos pa ni sbyor ba gcig pa yin na dngos po gnyis dang mang pos kyang ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur par bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: ma spangs shing zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byed cing gzhan lam spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ma spangs shing zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byed cing gzhan lam spangs pa'o //
